definition: plate/dish/tray/board/hard drive (computing)/to build/to coil/to check/to examine/to transfer (property)/to make over/classifier for food: dish, helping/to coil/classifier for coils of wire/classifier for games of chess
variant of 繞|绕[rao4], to rotate around/to spiral/to move around/to go round (an obstacle)/to by-pass/to make a detour
to wind/to coil (thread)/to rotate around/to spiral/to move around/to go round (an obstacle)/to by-pass/to make a detour/to confuse/to perplex

sentences.english: The staff with the snake has long been a symbol of medicine and the medical profession.
sentences.chinese: 长期以来，由蛇盘绕的权杖系医学及医学界的标志。

sentences.english: Dozens of hoses snaked through open doors or holes in the walls.
sentences.chinese: 从门洞和墙洞里伸出许多水管，盘绕散落。

sentences.english: Spirochetes Long spirally twisted bacteria surrounded by a flexible wall.
sentences.chinese: 是具有弹性外鞘的长形螺旋盘绕细菌。

sentences.english: He watched it drift through the pine tops.
sentences.chinese: 他望着这缕烟盘绕在树尖。

sentences.english: Long vines swirl round the tree.
sentences.chinese: 长长的藤葛盘绕在树身上。

sentences.english: the boundary around the round ground separates us from the surroundings.
sentences.chinese: 盘绕着圆形园地的界限将咱们同周围离隔。

sentences.english: The snake was coiled up on the grassland.
The country lane twists and turns between small cottages.
sentences.chinese: 乡间的小路在村舍之间蜿蜒盘绕。

sentences.english: The ivy twined round [around] the oak tree.
The snake coiled itself round the branch .
I have your arms around me warm like fire.
sentences.chinese: 你的手臂盘绕着我，暖和如火。

sentences.english: I let the hair on my legs entwine, the soy sauce on my chin congeal.
sentences.chinese: 我让头发在腿上盘绕，让茄酱在下巴凝结。

sentences.english: The vine twines round the tree.
The snake coiled round the branch.

definition: to spiral/to circle/to go around/to hover/to orbit
variant of 盤曲|盘曲[pan2 qu1]
to flutter/to dance in the breeze
intertwined (of tree roots or branches)/fig. an intricate matter
